dataprep.SamplingStrategies¶

class dataprep.SamplingStrategies.SRS(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: SamplingStrategy

Simple Random Sampling (SRS): randomly selects sample_size unique indices.

__init__(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Initialize SRS sampling strategy.

get_n_random_indices_in_list(n, elements)[source]¶

Return n unique random indices from the elements list.

sample_indices(n)[source]¶

Sample indices for each group and region.

class dataprep.SamplingStrategies.SamplingStrategy(stratify_regions, stratify_group, groups=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base class for sampling strategies. Subclasses should implement the sample_indices method.

__init__(stratify_regions, stratify_group, groups=None)[source]¶

population must be able to represent enough information to do every kind of sampling.

We do this by passing a list where each element corresponds to a group we want to sample from groups can be the same as experiment groups. Each groups is also a list of elements. Each of those elements is a list of images and represents a ROI (one or many split larger images)

By default, for each group, the same amount of images (n/group_count) are sampled. There can also be one group Also by default, all regions are stratified

example [ # groups [ # regions [img1, img2, img3], [img1, img2, img3] ] [ # regions [img1, img2, img3], [img1, img2, img3] ] ]

not sure if stratify_group should be a param

Sampling strategies may or may not require the image information, but it”s always passed and it’s used if needed.

get_group_and_region_counts_counts()[source]¶

Return group counts and region counts for the population.

get_group_count()[source]¶

Return the number of groups.

get_groups()[source]¶

Return the groups used for sampling.

abstract sample_indices()[source]¶

Return indices of the sampled items.

Parameters:

  • population_size (int) – Total number of items to sample from.

  • sample_size (int) – Number of items to sample.

  • **kwargs – Additional arguments for specific strategies.

Returns:

Array of selected indices.

Return type:

np.ndarray

set_population(population)[source]¶

Set the population and compute group and region counts.

suggest_n()[source]¶

Suggest sample size n (default -1).
